intro: Packera pseudaurea var. flavula, commonly known as the yellow fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cooler, moist conditions.
